    • run

      private void run()
      Configures and runs the server. Specifies the server endpoints and HTTP methods.

    • exceptionHandler

      public Object exceptionHandler(ServerException e, spark.Request req, spark.Response res)
      Handles all server exceptions and formats them.
      Parameters:
      e - Any ServerException.
      req - The Spark request object.
      res - The Spark response object.
      Returns:
      The error body.

    • clearApplication

      public Object clearApplication(spark.Request req, spark.Response res) throws ServerException
      The clearApplication handler. Passes data from the server to the AdminService.
      Parameters:
      req - The Spark request object
      res - The Spark response object
      Returns:
      Only returns success (200) or fail (500).
      Throws:
      ServerException

    • registerUser

      public Object registerUser(spark.Request req, spark.Response res) throws ServerException
      The registerUser handler gets the user data from the request body. Passes data from the server to the UserService.
      Parameters:
      req - The Spark request object.
      res - The Spark response object.
      Returns:
      If successful, returns the new user's username and their new authToken wrapped in a JSON object.
      Throws:
      ServerException

    • login

      public Object login(spark.Request req, spark.Response res) throws ServerException
      The login handler gets the user data from the request body. Passes data from the server to the AuthService.
      Parameters:
      req - The Spark request object.
      res - The Spark response object.
      Returns:
      If successful, returns the username and the authToken for the current session wrapped in a JSON object.
      Throws:
      ServerException

    • logout

      public Object logout(spark.Request req, spark.Response res) throws ServerException
      The logout handler verifies the AuthToken of the request. It sends data from the server to the AuthService.
      Parameters:
      req - The Spark request object.
      res - The Spark response object.
      Returns:
      Only returns success (200) or fail (500).
      Throws:
      ServerException

    • listGames

      public Object listGames(spark.Request req, spark.Response res) throws ServerException
      The listGames handler verifies the AuthToken of the request. It sends data from the server to the AuthService.
      Parameters:
      req - The Spark request object.
      res - The Spark response object.
      Returns:
      A list of all games as a JSON object.
      Throws:
      ServerException

    • createGame

      public Object createGame(spark.Request req, spark.Response res) throws ServerException
      The createGame handler verifies the AuthToken of the request, and gets the game data from the request body. It sends data from the server to the AuthService.
      Parameters:
      req - The Spark request object
      res - The Spark response object
      Returns:
      The new gameID wrapped in a JSON object.
      Throws:
      ServerException

    • joinGame

      public Object joinGame(spark.Request req, spark.Response res) throws ServerException
      Throws:
      ServerException

    • responseJSON

      private static String responseJSON(Object... props)
      Takes an even number of Objects and serializes them into JSON. For example, "responseJSON("name", this.name)" would return {"name": "jeffrey"}
      Returns:
      The JSON object.

    • getBody

      private static <T> T getBody(spark.Request request, Class<T> classType) throws ServerException
      Gets the body from the HTTP request and deserializes it into a GSON object of a given type.
      Parameters:
      request - The Spark Request object
      classType - The type of object to create and return.
      Returns:
      The object created by deserializing the request.
      Throws:
      ServerException - Throws an error if there is no Request body.

    • getAuthorization

      private AuthToken getAuthorization(spark.Request req) throws ServerException
      Gets the authorization string from the request header, and checks the database for the token.
      Parameters:
      req - The Spark Request object
      Returns:
      The AuthToken connected to the string token
      Throws:
      ServerException - Throws a 401 exception if not authorized.
